captions.text: this is Teego
he's an eleven week old
brown and cream marbled Kitten
This is Freya
she's a six-year-old Bengal cat
Bengal cats are a domestic crossbreed
from the wild Asian Leopard Cat
and if the Daily Express is to be believed

she'll break through your catflap at night, 
and kill your own cats!

so this is the story of how the two cats 
managed their first week together
Teego spent his first three days in a separate room
with Freya sniffing at the door
he's a confident kitten

and unusually had no fears about exploring 
outside his room
he looks around this new area
and bounds down to explore further

Freya is watching from a safe place 
and is NOT impressed!

However, she shows no desire to leap down 
and attack this intruder!
but won't take her eyes off him

Teego barely notices this as there are 
far too many shiny things around for him to be bothered!
their first face-to-face meeting goes very well
Teego's playful bounce over
gives no hint that he
could possibly be a threat

Freya's still the boss, so she hisses, 
just to make her point
Teego carries on exploring
apparently unworried by Freya's hissing and growling
after a while,
Teego pops back upstairs
just to double-check his safe place is still there

Teego's boisterousness is always present
and slippery floors can be awkward
Fortunately, all of Freya's signals and body language
are more nervous curiosity
rather than anything aggressive

she doesn't want to be friends just now
but she's certainly interested and curious
as she'd simply leave the room if she really didn't like it
as youngsters do, he's always pushing his luck
he doesn't mean any harm
he's just overwhelmed by all the fun things to do down here
for a moment
he even forgets about Freya
Freya however, is still fascinated
the following day
Freya is still trying to teach him who's boss
when he strays too close without paying attention

naturally Teego takes this is an invitation
to play
after a couple of days of this

we're starting to think that Freya might
be enjoying this little brat a tiny bit
but she still wanders around grizzling
so nobody thinks she's gone soft
the next day shows further improvement
but Freya's not going to give in THAT easily!
Teego seems obsessed by Freya's tail

which will probably end up teaching him a lesson
about curiosity, and cats.
both cats are now really showing signs of play
the fights are mainly friendly
but freya forgets her own strength every now and then
sometimes, little kittens just don't get the hint
that playtime is not always wanted

little Teego can't seem to understand 
how she doesn't want to wrestle ALL the time!
maybe a game of Queen of the castle will solve the problem?
another day passes, and even Freya is initiating play fights now!
As the days pass
the fights become more playful
and soon, even Freya realises that having a baby brother
could be the best thing in the world

title: Introducing Bengal cat to a new kitten for first time

comments.text:

him/her, blow dry thoroughly, and then EAT HER WHOLE.﻿

comments.text:
Two cats getting to know each other. I've never owned a Bengal Hybrid, but 
I have been owned by many other cats for nearly 30 years. And EVERY TIME I 
bring a stray kitten home, this sort of behavior ALWAYS happens for a few 
weeks. They always play and make up.﻿

they used to be, I miss the old guy.﻿

comments.text:
Right now I have a little girl named Luna who is about 8 or 9 months old. 
She was a stray and I rescued her and she has been living with me for 2 
months or more. She loves her home and is a happy indoor cat with a very 
unique personality since she was a stray her whole life. I am looking into 
getting another cat since she is by her self sometimes and very hyper. I 
was thinking of getting a male cat so I can have a cuddle bug and adopt one 
from a shelter. What is a good age for a new cat if I get one? Like I said 
Luna is about 8 or 9 months and is in her rebellious and independent 
"teenage" stage lol﻿

comments.text:
nope u are stupid and blind. if the bigger one is the nice one. hes 
actually doing the smaller one a favor by running away and not ripping the 
little one apart as they grapple. as you can see the little cat can 
strike the big one as much as he likes with little effect.i have observed 
this same action with all the tiger vs lion videos on youtube. I know for a 
fact that the lion is the more dangerous fighter.its literally what they 
are made to do. tigers are effective solitary hunters. lions are effective 
brawlers they need to be in order to take over a pride.  tigers could do 
nothing to them in a serious battle .tiger hits lion , lion says is that as 
hard as u can hit? why don't you hit me again pussy <lol. anyway cats are 
always in the alpha brain wave witch means they are always trying to 
dominate each other. this is why I believe the larger one shows restraint 
as he knows its the kittens nature to try to dominate him. the little one 
is the asshole 100% hes invading the older cats territory and attacks him 
with little to no respect. I understand not wanting the neighborhood cats 
ripping each other apart I always stop the battles myself. I don't want my 
kitty looking like scar from the lion king. my point is that if the 
older one was the mean one he would finish him. he would hunt him down and 
kill him without as much as shaking a paw afterward because its perfectly 
within his capability. not even its owner could stop him believe me. once a 
cat sets its mind to something its do or die . the fact that he doesn't and 
is tolerant of being hunted by that little brat is a beautiful thing﻿
